title: Prohibits the possession of bushmeat and imposes civil penalties therefor
summary: Prohibits the possession of bushmeat and imposes civil penalties therefor.
fulltext:
S T A T E   O F   N E W   Y O R K
       ________________________________________________________________________

                                         3731

                              2011-2012 Regular Sessions

                                 I N  A S S E M B L Y

                                   January 26, 2011
                                      ___________

       Introduced  by M. of A. KELLNER -- read once and referred to the Commit-
         tee on Environmental Conservation

       AN ACT to amend the  environmental  conservation  law,  in  relation  to
         prohibiting the possession, transportation and sale of bushmeat

         THE  PEOPLE OF THE STATE OF NEW YORK, REPRESENTED IN SENATE AND ASSEM-
       BLY, DO ENACT AS FOLLOWS:

    1    Section 1. The environmental conservation law is amended by  adding  a
    2  new section 11-0538 to read as follows:
    3  S 11-0538. POSSESSION OF BUSHMEAT; PROHIBITED.
    4    1.  A.  NOTWITHSTANDING  ANY  OTHER  PROVISION  OF  THIS  CHAPTER, THE
    5  POSSESSION, IMPORTATION, TRANSPORTATION, SALE OR TAKING  OF  THE  FLESH,
    6  BONES, SKELETON, SKULL, BLOOD, ORGAN, OTHER BODY PARTS OR CARCASS OF ANY
    7  SPECIES DEFINED IN PARAGRAPH B OF THIS SUBDIVISION.
    8    B.  PARAGRAPH  A  OF  THIS  SUBDIVISION  SHALL  APPLY TO THE FOLLOWING
    9  SPECIES:
   10  FAMILY                              ORDER/COMMON
   11  ARTIODACTYLA
   12  BOVIDAE
   13  AFRICAN BUFFALO                     SYNCERUS CAFFER
   14  BOHOR REEDBUCK                      REDUNCA REDUNCA
   15  BONGO                               BOOCERCUS EURYCEROS
   16  BUSHBUCK                            TRAGELAPHUS SCRIPTUS
   17  CAPE GRYSBOK                        RAPHICERUS MELANOTIS
   18  COMMON ELAND                        TRAGELAPHUS (TAUROTRAGUS)
   19  DIK DIK                             MADOQUA SPP.
   20  DUIKER                              CEPHALOPHUS SPP.
   21  FOREST BUFFALO                      SYNCERUS CAFFER NANUS
   22  GEMSBOK OR ORYX                     ORYX GAZELLA
   23  GRANT'S GAZELLE                     GAZELLA GRANTI
   24  GREATER KUDU                        TRAGELAPHUS STREPSICEROS
   25  HARTEBEEST                          ALCELAPHUS BUSELAPHUS

        EXPLANATION--Matter in ITALICS (underscored) is new; matter in brackets
                             [ ] is old law to be omitted.
                                                                  LBD07336-01-1

   28  CARNIVORA
   29  CANIDAE
   30  BAT EARED FOX                       OTOCYON MEGALOTIS
   31  BLACK BACKED JACKAL                 CANIS MESOMELAS
   32  FELIDAE
   33  GOLDEN CAT                          FELIS AURATA
   34  LEOPARD                             PANTHERA PARDUS
   35  MELLIVORINAE

   39  SPOT-NECKED OTTER                   LUTRA MACULICOLLIS
   40  VIVERRIDAE

   44  JOHNSTON'S GET                      GETTA JOHNSTONI
   45  LEIGHTON'S LINSANG                  POIANA RICHARDSONII LIBERISIS

   47  MONGOOSE                            CROSSARCHUS & HERPESTES SPP.
   48  SMALL SPOTTED GET                   GETTA SERVALINA
   49  TWO SPOTTED PALM CIVET              NANDINIA BINOTATA
   50  CORACIIFORMES
   51  BUCEROTIDAE
   52  BLACK-CASQUED HORNBILL              CERATOGYMNA ATRATA
   53  BLACK AND WHITE CASQUED HORNBILL    BYCANISTES SUBCLINDRICUS
   54  CUCULIFORMES
   55  MUSOPHAGIDAE
   56  BLUE PLANTAINEATER                  CORYTHAEOLA CRISTATA

       A. 3731                             3

    1  FALCONIFORMES
    2  ACCIPITRIDAE
    3  CROWNED HAWK EAGLE                  STEPHANAOETUS CORNOATUS
    4  GALLIFORMES
    5  PHASIANIDAE
    6  HELMETED OR TUFTED GUINEA FOWL      NUMIDA MELEAGRIS

   10  LAGOMORPHA

   16  PHOLIDOTA
   17  MANIDAE

   19  GIANT PANGOLIN                      MANIS GIGANTEA ILLIGER
   20  PRIMATES

   22  COLLARED MANGABEY                   CERCOCEBUS TORQUATUS
   23  CRESTED MANGABEY                    CERCOCEBUS GALERITIS
   24  DRILL                               MANDRILLUS LEUCOPHAEUS
   25  GREATER WHITE NOSED MONKEY          CERCOPITHECUS NICTITANS
   26  GREY CHEEKED MANGABEY               CERCOCEBUS ALBIGA
   27  CERCOPITHECINAE
   28  BABOON                              PAPIO CYNOCEPHALUS
   29  CROWNED GUON                        CERCOPITHECUS POGONIAS
   30  DE BRAZZA'S MONKEY                  CERCOPITHECUS NEGLECTUS
   31  DIANA MONKEY                        CERCOPITHECUS DIANA
   32  MANDRILL                            MANDRILLUS LEUCOPHAEUS
   33  MONA MONKEY                         CERCOPITHECUS MONA
   34  MOUSTACHED MONKEY                   CERCOPITHECUS CEPHUS
   35  OWL FACED MONKEY                    CERCOPITHECUS HAMLYNI
   36  PREUSS'S MONKEY                     CERCOPITHECUS PREUSSI
   37  RED-EARED MONKEY/RUSSETEARED GUON   CERCOPITHECUS ERYTHROTIS
   38  SAMANGO MONKEY                      CERCOPITHECUS MITIS
   39  SCLATER'S MONKEY                    CERCOPITHECUS SCLATERI
   40  SUN TAILED MONKEY                   CERCOPITHECUS SOLATUS
   41  TALAPOIN                            MIOPITHECUS TALAPOIN
   42  WHITE-NOSED MONKEY                  CERCOPITHECUS NICTITANS
   43  WHITE-THROATED MONKEY               CERCOPITHECUS ERYTHROGASTER
   44  COLOBIDAE
   45  BLACK COLOBUS                       COLOBUS SATANAS
   46  EASTERN BLACK & WHITE COLOBUS       COLOBUS GUEREZA
   47  GEOFFREY'S PIED COLOBUS             COLOBUS VELLEROSUS
   48  RED COLOBUS                         COLOBUS BADIUS PNANTI
   49  LORIDAE
   50  POTTO                               PERODICTUS POTTO
   51  PONGIDAE
   52  BONOBO                              PAN PANISCUS
   53  CHIMPANZEE                          PAN TROGLODYTES I
   54  CROSS RIVER GORILLA                 GORILLA GORILLA SSP. DIEHLI
   55  GRAUER'S OR EASTERN LOWLAND         GORILLA GORILLA BERINGEI

       A. 3731                             4

    1                                      GRAUERI
    2  MOUNTAIN GORILLA                    GORILLA BERINGEI BERINGEI I
    3  WESTERN LOWLAND GORILLA             GORILLA GORILLA GORILLA I
    4  PROBOSCIDEA
    5  ELEPHANTIDAE
    6  AFRICAN ELEPHANT                    LOXODONTA AFRICANA
    7  RODTIA
    8  HYSTRICIDAE
    9  BRUSH-TAILED PORCUPINE              ARTHERURUS AFRICANUS
   10  MURIDAE
   11  GIANT RAT                           CRICETOMYS EMINI
   12  PEDETIDAE
   13  SPRINGHARE                          PEDETES CAPSIS
   14  SCIURIDAE
   15  RUWZORI SUN SQUIRREL                HELIOSCHIURUS RUWZORII
   16  THRYONOMYIDAE
   17  GREATER CANE RAT (GRASSCUTTER)      THRIONOMYS SWINDERIANUS
   18  STRUTHIONEFORMES
   19  STRUTHIONIDAE
   20  OSTRICH                             STRUTHIO CAMELUS
   21  SQUAMATA
   22  BOIDAE
   23  ROCK PYTHON                         PYTHON SEHAE
   24  VARANIDAE
   25  MONITOR LIZARD                      VARANUS SPP.
   26  TESTUDINES
   27  TESTUDINIDAE
   28  FOREST TORTOISE                     KYNIXIS EROSA SCHWEIGGER
   29    C.  THE  COMMISSIONER  SHALL,  BY  REGULATION,  ESTABLISH A PROCESS TO
   30  RECEIVE PUBLIC COMMENT ON SPECIES THAT SHOULD BE ADDED TO THE PROVISIONS
   31  OF PARAGRAPH B OF THIS SUBDIVISION.
   32    2. ANY OFFICER OR AGENT AUTHORIZED BY THE COMMISSIONER OR  ANY  POLICE
   33  OFFICER,  AS  DEFINED  IN SUBDIVISION THIRTY-FOUR OF SECTION 1.20 OF THE
   34  CRIMINAL PROCEDURE LAW, SHALL HAVE THE AUTHORITY TO EXECUTE ANY  WARRANT
   35  TO  SEARCH  FOR  OR  SEIZE  ANY  FLESH, BONES, SKELETONS, SKULLS, BLOOD,
   36  ORGANS, OTHER BODY PARTS OR CARCASSES POSSESSED, IMPORTED,  TRANSPORTED,
   37  SOLD  OR  TAKEN  IN VIOLATION OF SUBDIVISION ONE OF THIS SECTION, OR ANY
   38  PROPERTY OR ITEM USED IN CONNECTION WITH A VIOLATION  OF  SUCH  SUBDIVI-
   39  SION;  AND  SUCH  FLESH,  BONES, SKELETONS, SKULLS, BLOOD, ORGANS, OTHER
   40  BODY PARTS AND CARCASSES SHALL BE HELD PENDING PROCEEDINGS IN ANY  COURT
   41  OF  PROPER  JURISDICTION.  UPON  CONVICTION, OR UPON ENTRY OF A JUDGMENT
   42  RESTRAINING ANY VIOLATION OF  SUBDIVISION  ONE  OF  THIS  SECTION,  SUCH
   43  SEIZED  FLESH, BONES, SKELETONS, SKULLS, BLOOD, ORGANS, OTHER BODY PARTS
   44  OR  CARCASSES  SHALL  BE  FORFEITED  AND,  UPON  FORFEITURE,  SHALL   BE
   45  DESTROYED.
   46    3.  THE  DEPARTMENT SHALL HAVE THE AUTHORITY TO SEEK INJUNCTIVE RELIEF
   47  IN ANY COURT OF PROPER JURISDICTION TO  ENJOIN  CONTINUED  VIOLATION  OF
   48  SUBDIVISION ONE OF THIS SECTION.
   49    4. THE PROVISIONS OF SUBDIVISION ONE OF THIS SECTION SHALL NOT APPLY:
   50    A.  TO ANY PERSON HOLDING A VALID PERMIT ISSUED PURSUANT TO THE UNITED
   51  STATES ENDANGERED SPECIES ACT OR THE CONVENTION ON  INTERNATIONAL  TRADE
   52  IN ENDANGERED SPECIES OF WILD FAUNA AND FLORA; OR
   53    B.  TO ANY PERSON CERTIFIED BY THE COMMISSIONER AS BEING IN POSSESSION
   54  FOR ZOOLOGICAL, EDUCATIONAL OR SCIENTIFIC PURPOSES, AND IS NOT OTHERWISE
   55  PROHIBITED BY ANY STATE OR FEDERAL LAW, RULE OR REGULATION.

       A. 3731                             5

    1    S 2. Section 71-0925 of the environmental conservation law is  amended
    2  by adding a new subdivision 15 to read as follows:
    3    15.  IF  THE  VIOLATION  WAS  AN  ACT PROHIBITED BY SUBDIVISION ONE OF
    4  SECTION 11-0538 OF THIS CHAPTER, OR BY ANY LAWFUL RULE OR REGULATION  OF
    5  THE DEPARTMENT PROMULGATED PURSUANT THERETO, A CIVIL PENALTY OF NOT MORE
    6  THAN  FIVE HUNDRED DOLLARS FOR THE FIRST CONVICTION THEREOF; AND A CIVIL
    7  PENALTY OF NOT MORE THAN ONE THOUSAND DOLLARS FOR A SECOND OR SUBSEQUENT
    8  CONVICTION. EACH INSTANCE  OF  VIOLATION  SHALL  CONSTITUTE  A  SEPARATE
    9  OFFENSE.
   10    S 3. Severability. If any clause, sentence, paragraph, section or part
   11  of  this act shall be adjudged by any court of competent jurisdiction to
   12  be invalid and after exhaustion of  all  further  judicial  review,  the
   13  judgment  shall  not affect, impair or invalidate the remainder thereof,
   14  but shall be confined in its operation to the  clause,  sentence,  para-
   15  graph,  section or part of this act directly involved in the controversy
   16  in which the judgment shall have been rendered.
   17    S 4. This act shall take effect immediately.
actClause: AN ACT to amend the environmental conservation law, in relation to prohibiting the possession, transportation and sale of bushmeat
